rev.comment: Per [[Wikipedia:Fair_use_review#Image:Kirby_hobo_festival.jpg]], fair use review concluded this use is not acceptable
rev.diff:
Line 111: Line 111:
===Northern Kirby===
===Northern Kirby===
â
[[Image:Kirby hobo festival.jpg|thumb|Poster promoting Kirby's first annual "Hobo Festival"]]
 
The northern section of the city comprises of [[Kirby Middle School]], Old Seguin Road, FM 78, Gibbs Sprawl as well as the [[Union Pacific]] railroad tracks. Because of the railroad tracks, Kirby has been dubbed "The [[hobo]] capital of Texas" <ref>[http://www.clickitsa.com/content/view/18948/411/ Northeast Herald], March 20, 2008</ref> because of its large population of [[homeless people]] living under the 410 overpass. It is because of this fact that the city will hold its first annual "hobo festival" during the first weekend of May 2008, including a "hobo parade" through the streets of Kirby. <ref> [http://www.kirbytx.org/docs/news/kirby_minutes.html City of Kirby] November 6 2007 </ref> Kirby Manor and the Old Town neighborhoods are included in this area.
The northern section of the city comprises of [[Kirby Middle School]], Old Seguin Road, FM 78, Gibbs Sprawl as well as the [[Union Pacific]] railroad tracks. Because of the railroad tracks, Kirby has been dubbed "The [[hobo]] capital of Texas" <ref>[http://www.clickitsa.com/content/view/18948/411/ Northeast Herald], March 20, 2008</ref> because of its large population of [[homeless people]] living under the 410 overpass. It is because of this fact that the city will hold its first annual "hobo festival" during the first weekend of May 2008, including a "hobo parade" through the streets of Kirby. <ref> [http://www.kirbytx.org/docs/news/kirby_minutes.html City of Kirby] November 6 2007 </ref> Kirby Manor and the Old Town neighborhoods are included in this area.
